overview_of_class: The course explores the diverse objectives of Arts Organizations involved in what is broadly defined as Community Outreach/Engagement. It begins with a review of the different goals/objectives of community outreach including; education, recruiting new talent, social justice, responding to the needs of at risk youth, access to opportunities for underserved populations, appealing to potential funders, and establishing a unique relationship with a specific constituency. Students undertake analysis of a successful initiative, including fieldwork opportunities. The class will also participate in a school partnership and other potential projects on campus. The final project involves development of a proposal for a new initiative.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
Students will assess existing models of outreach/engagement through the arts.
Students will develop a deeper understanding of the many roles of dance and theatre in the community.
Students will apply their learning through experiences with partner organizations in the design of new initiatives.
